head.supplied: Melbourne, ¶ 5/4/89 ¶ To the Undersecretary of the Lands-Departm., ¶ Wellington. ¶ Sir,...

div.p: LS/53/10 registered files, no. 89/45, Forests and Agricultural Branch, National Archives of New Zealand, Wellington.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p: To the Undersecretary of the Lands-Departm.,

In accordance with your request
H. Eliott to M, 8 March 1889; see also M to H. Eliott, 22 March 1889. I have the honor of transmitting by this post 1 lb of seeds of Eucalyptus corynocalyx, the Sugar-Gum-tree. This is the whole quantity of seeds, available at present. The species is almost restricted to South-Australia, and even there restricted to a few regions only; thus also the seeds of it are more expensive, than those of most other congeners; but I obtained this quantity at a somewhat lower rate than usual. Please inform me, whether this lot will suffice for present purposes or whether the additional quantity, as first determined on, ought to be purposely collected.
M acquired the seed from E. B. Heyne & Co., Rundle St, Adelaide, having also asked Otto Tepper whether he could secure a supply (see M to O. Tepper, 22 March 1889 (in this edition as 89-03-22b)). The total cost including charges by the time it was received in NZ was £3.1.6 ([Fras.] Stevens to M, 3 May 1889).

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be, Sir,
